data.stimulus:
Academic texts include both DESCRIPTIVE and CRITICAL writing.

 

► What do "descriptive" and "critical" mean?

Reporting Verbs

Reporting verbs are used to incorporate sources into your writing.

Use different reporting verbs to show your opinion about the source of information you are citing.

 

► Choose the best reporting verbs for each situation below:

 

Your source is giving an opinion. You should use...
Your source is giving factual information. You should use...
The information in your sources proves your point. You should use...

Next, let's look at each Reporting Verb in more detail...

► Choose the best verb for each definition.
data.template:
• To give details about something: {{response}}
  • To say something indirectly or tentatively: {{response}}
  • To say something directly: {{response}}
  • To make an argument, often used when others disagree: {{response}}
  • To suggest something indirectly: {{response}}

• To give reasons for a view: {{response}}
  • To give particular importance to something: {{response}}
  • To show something: {{response}}
  • To refer to something briefly: {{response}}
  • To suggest something is inaccurate: {{response}}

data.stimulus:
EVALUATION 

Evaluation is when you explain the significance of evidence. 

This may seem clear to you, but you need to make sure it is clear to the reader!

 

► Make sure to explain...
data.template:
• {{response}} about the evidence (do you agree/disagree?).
  • {{response}} you think the evidence is significant.
  • {{response}} one piece of evidence is similar to or different from another.
  • {{response}} the evidence shows.
  • How the evidence {{response}} your argument.

value: Based on this evidence, it can be assumed that sales will continue to rise.
These figures suggest that the marketing campaign has been reasonably successful.
This demonstrates that the suggested measure can be implemented successfully.
These results seem to confirm the theory that customers connect higher prices with higher quality.

possible_responses: These figures suggest that the marketing campaign has been reasonably successful.
Based on this evidence, it can be assumed that sales will continue to rise.
This demonstrates that the suggested measure can be implemented successfully.
These results seem to confirm the theory that customers connect higher prices with higher quality.
data.stimulus:
Evaluation sentences usually come after your evidence.

Consider the sentences below. The first sentence presents the evidence.

► Choose the best evaluative sentence to follow.
stimulus_list: Data from 2019 showed sales rose by 9% in the previous year (Statista, 2019).
Samsung (2020) reported preorders for the new model exceeded those for all earlier versions.
Several industry competitors have introduced in-store recycling in the last five years, without significant set-up issues (Jones & Wardle, 2019).
78% of those interviewed in Jones's study, chose the premium brand because the assumed it would be more reliable.

value: It can be inferred from this result that convenience is more important to consumers than cost.
According to this theory, gender equality probably cannot be achieved in the workplace in the near future.
These responses appear to indicate low levels of public confidence in the government scheme.
However, this claim has been disputed by other experts in the field, who point to the dangers of focusing on such short-term gains.

possible_responses: It can be inferred from this result that convenience is more important to consumers than cost.
According to this theory, gender equality probably cannot be achieved in the workplace in the near future.
These responses appear to indicate low levels of public confidence in the government scheme.
However, this claim has been disputed by other experts in the field, who point to the dangers of focusing on such short-term gains.
stimulus_list: The vast majority of respondents (88%) replied that next-day delivery was the most important feature of the service.
Fairchild (2016) argued that social change would always slow down in the face of economic recession.
In the latest survey (Gallup, 2020), 70% of the respondents said they would not download the app unless it was compulsory.
Hardy (2017) argues that it is worth pursuing this aggressive sales tactic, as the profits made will outweigh losses.

value: It can be inferred from this result that convenience is more important to consumers than cost.
According to this theory, gender equality probably cannot be achieved in the workplace in the near future.
These responses appear to indicate low levels of public confidence in the government scheme.
However, this claim has been disputed by other experts in the field, who point to the dangers of focusing on such short-term gains.
However, this claim does not consider her own admission that companies and politicians misinform the public about the scale of the problem.
This suggests that although all stakeholders should be encouraged to reduce their impact, business should be the primary focus of CO2 reduction policy.
These figures demonstrate the importance of maintaining a public transport network.
This decline could be due to increased political instability in the country.

possible_responses: However, this claim does not consider her own admission that companies and politicians misinform the public about the scale of the problem.
This suggests that although all stakeholders should be encouraged to reduce their impact, business should be the primary focus of CO2 reduction policy.
These figures demonstrate the importance of maintaining a public transport network.
This decline could be due to increased political instability in the country.
stimulus_list: Nuccitelli (2018) argues that individuals should take partial responsibility for the lack of climate change action, as they do not use their voting power to demand better policies.
Hyman (2020) points out that companies produce more than double the CO2 admissions of individuals.
Government data (Department for Transport, 2020) show that 19% of the UK public do not have access to a car or van.
Arkwright (2016) observed that the number of visitors had fallen substantially in recent years.

value: However, this claim does not consider her own admission that companies and politicians misinform the public about the scale of the problem.
This suggests that although all stakeholders should be encouraged to reduce their impact, business should be the primary focus of CO2 reduction policy.
These figures demonstrate the importance of maintaining a public transport network.
This decline could be due to increased political instability in the country.

options.label: However / on the other hand / although
Therefore / as a result / thus / consequently

data.stimulus:
Linking Words

Using linking words is a useful way to introduce your comments on evidence. 

 

 

► Choose the best linking word for each situation below:

 

You want to make a contrasting point or add an opposing view. You should use...

options.label: However / on the other hand / although
Therefore / as a result / thus / consequently

data.stimulus: You want to add a point or more evidence to support the same idea. You should use...

options.label: However / on the other hand / although
Therefore / as a result / thus / consequently

data.stimulus: You want to show the logical consequence of the information you presented. You should use...

Next, let's look at linking words in context...

► Read the sentences carefully. Choose the best linking word for each one.
data.template:
1. Experts agree that organic cotton is the most sustainable form of cotton (Textile Exchange, 2019). {{response}}, it is important to consider practical aspects, such as cost and sourcing.
2. Experts agree that organic cotton is the most sustainable form of cotton (Textile Exchange, 2019). {{response}}, it should be used more if the company wishes to improve its green credentials.
3. Experts agree that organic cotton is the most sustainable form of cotton (Textile Exchange, 2019). {{response}}, the lack of chemicals makes it suitable for sensitive skin.

4. {{response}}, 55% of customers express a preference for face-to-face customer service (Personnel, 2019), this could be due to unsatisfactory experiences with online services in the past.

5. 55% of customers express a preference for face-to-face customer service (Personnel, 2019).  {{response}}, it is recommended that stores continue to provide helpdesks in store.

6. 55% of customers express a preference for face-to-face customer service (Personnel, 2019).  {{response}}, half of these said it was the most important factor.

7. Smithson (2015) claims the key to reducing waste is to produce more durable garments. {{response}}, Timpson (2017) argues that durability is not an issue, if the discarded garments are easily recyclable.

8. Smithson (2015) claims that the key to reducing waste is to produce more durable garments. {{response}}, Marky (2017) suggests in-store repair services will increase longevity of clothing.

9. Smithson (2015) claims the key to reducing waste is to produce more durable garments. {{response}}, as Duran (2014) argues, the logical next step is to research more durable materials.

data.stimulus:
Closing Sentences

It is important to include a closing sentence in paragraphs where you discuss sources.

This allows you to evaluate the evidence and move your argument forward.

 

► It is an essential feature of Critical Writing!

 

Read the notes below carefully and choose the best word to complete each one.
data.template:
What is a Closing Sentence?

  • A closing sentence sentence shows you are {{response}}  of the paragraph.

  • This is where you evaluate everything you have written about {{response}}.

  • You need to show the reader {{response}} of the paragraph (what the evidence teaches us) and why it is important.

  • It does not include any {{response}}.

  • It is important to write effective closing sentences, to give your {{response}} on the evidence you have discussed in each paragraph and to show that the {{response}} of the report are being met.

list: Summarise the key ideas in the paragraph.
Draw a conclusion based on the key ideas in the paragraph.
Make a link to the next paragraph.
Show how this paragraph connects to your overall aim.
data.stimulus:
So, what does a strong closing sentence include?

Put the functions below in a logical order.

 

► Note: A closing sentence may not include all of these functions, only ONE is mandatory!

stems: Summarise the key ideas in the paragraph.
Draw a conclusion based on the key ideas in the paragraph.
Make a link  to the next paragraph.
Show how this paragraph connects to your overall aim.
data.stimulus:
Only ONE of these functions is essential, the others are optional.

 

► Which function of the closing sentence is ESSENTIAL?

Although pointing out problems in the research is NOT the main aim of critical writing, this may be necessary.

It’s useful to have a bank of phrases to introduce criticisms you may find in the research you read.

► Here are some useful phrases - organise the words into complete sentences.

data.template: 2. One {{response}} {{response}} {{response}}  {{response}} is that...
3. The {{response}} {{response}} {{response}}  {{response}} if it had {{response}} {{response}} about …
4. Perhaps {{response}}  {{response}} {{response}} {{response}} {{response}} is that...
6. The {{response}} {{response}} {{response}} {{response}} {{response}} {{response}} if the researchers had  …
